Description:
With a resounding impact, the greatsword cleaves through the air, connecting with the beast's tail in a mighty blow. The wyvern wheels around, its massive jaws primed to ensnare the warrior in their deadly embrace. In a daring maneuver, the fighter relinquishes her blade, seizing the wyvern's jaw in a vice-like grip, diverting its momentum towards a nearby tree. She ascends onto the creature's head, plunging her blade deep into its eye with lethal precision. It is then that you observe a miraculous sight: her previously bloody wounds have miraculously sealed, as if cauterized by the scorching heat of battle and the coursing adrenaline of combat.
Warriors are talented in using any type of weapon, with hand-to-hand combat capabilities way beyond the average adventurer. Brawn and tactics are a warrior's aces in the sleeve.
A warrior is a physical combatant, but that does not stop them from overcoming challenges. With mastery over arms, body or range, a warrior may improvise and lead their way to victory.
Proficiency Requirements: You have Skilled in Athletics, Acrobatics and have a number of extra non-combat Skills equal to your Intelligence or Sense, whichever is higher.

~Skilled in Athletics~.Effect: Add your Level to all Might Checks for using your physical strength (e.g. lifting, breaking by hand, etc).

~Skilled in Acrobatics~.Effect: Add your Level to all Dexterity Checks for jumping, climbing, fitting through gaps, maintaining balance and other acrobatic moves.

Proficiencies Description: Your physical training as a Warrior provides you with enough practice and muscle memory to be able to succeed at the more difficult hand-to-hand tasks, such as swimming, lifting and jumping.
Weapons: You are Trained in all weapons, including Shields.

Spellcasting.Spell Grade: 6 + Intelligence, Sense or Charisma, whichever is higher

Mana.Regain: You regain all Mana back inbetween Adventures.

Spellcasting.Change: You can change your known Spells and Talents inbetween Adventures.
Spellcasting.Other: All Warrior-specific Abilities are not considered Spells (unless stated otherwise).
Spellcasting.Recommended Abilities Description: Warriors should be able to withhold damage, and as such, we recommend Recuperate for some extra healing and breaking enemy effects on you. Slam will provide you with area damage and Chilling Shout is a great ranged attack for the Mana cost. If you still have more available Basic Spells, no-one ever complained about having Bull Rush - it's a great passive effect for dealing extra damage. Lastly, if your Sense is low, Atonement will be great in combat for survival, if you're expecting to take a lot of damage.

~Advanced Flank~.Effect:
The first time you _flank_ an enemy every turn, the attack deals +1d6 Damage.
Also, your melee weapon attacks Flank an enemy if they are pinned against a wall or an obstacle as well.
~Advanced Flank~.Note:
{Flank}
Also, instead of an ally being behind the enemy, your attacks count as Flanking even if there is a wall or another obstacle directly behind them.

~Charge~.Effect:
Freely dash exactly 2 meters towards a Worthy Enemy, landing on the closest space. It becomes Rooted.
You can only use this once on every Worthy Enemy.

Starting Abilities Description.Advanced Flank:
Warriors are great at using their teammates and the terrain to make flanking attacks!
When an enemy is caught directly between you and another ally of yours, that attack counts as a Flank Attack, and it deals +1 Damage (normally). Your Advanced Flank transforms the +1 into 1d6 Damage to the first Flank Attack you make every turn!
This works now if there is a wall or an obstacle directly behind your target, so use the environment to your advantage!
Note that this only works for melee attacks and on enemies 1 meter away from you (e.g. enemies directly in front of you).

Specializations.Description: At Level 1, you can choose your specialization. Every Warrior can choose from the following Warrior specializations
Choices: Fighter, a person specialized in weapon fighting and body-to-body combat
Battlemaster, a heavily trained and armed warrior; master yourself - master the enemy
Barbarian, a crude and battle thirsty warrior, who seeks to shed blood and lives for the fight
Marksman, a precise and mechanical soldier, always finding the best tactic and position; the Marksman wins the battle before it begins

<Quick Maneuvers>.Effect: Immediately after you make a weapon attack, use Sprint, Push, Taunt or Hamstring for free.
<Quick Maneuvers>.Notes: Sprint (run up to 2 meters), Push (push a non-Epic medium-sized Unit 1 meter in any direction), Taunt (make a Unit have -2 on its next attack if it's not on you), Hamstring (slow a Unit).

<Opportunity Attacks>.Effect: When an enemy moves 1 or more meters away from near you, you can make a free attack on them with a 1-Handed Melee Weapon.
<Opportunity Attacks>.Notes: If you don't have a 1-Handed Weapone equipped, you automatically freely equip one, attack with it, unequip it and equip what you previously had.

~Recovery Maneuvers~.Effect: Immediately after you make a weapon attack, use Sprint, Push, Taunt or Hamstring for free ~or heal yourself for 1d4.~
~Recovery Maneuvers~.Notes: Sprint (run up to 2 meters), Push (push a non-Epic medium-sized Unit 1 meter in any direction), Taunt (make a Unit have -2 on its next attack if it's not on you), Hamstring (slow a Unit).

<Might Over Magic>.Effect:
Choose a Basic Ability from the Elemental or Nature Schools that costs 1 Mana.
You can use that Ability once per Adventure, without spending Mana.
That Ability becomes a ^physical version of itself^: instead of using magic to cast that spell, you use your body/weapons/tools.
<Might Over Magic>.Upgrade: Come up with a description of how it works! You can change this Ability inbetween Advetures.
<Might Over Magic>.Notes:
The Damage of that spell becomes Slash, Smash or Pierce, whichever makes sense.
E.g. Scorching Rays - you shoot 3 arrows with your bow (Pierce Damage).
E.g. Frost Nova - you smash the ground with such force that it Damages and Slows units around you (Smash Damage).
Be creative!

<Weaponmaster>.Effect:
Your weapon attacks have an extra effect.
When you get this, choose one weapon effect from the list below.
You also have that weapon effect on all weapons you use, exactly as written, no matter what weapon you are using.
You can change this weapon effect between combats.
<Weaponmaster>.Notes: Weapons stating "the die" (or such) now refer to any one die of the dice rolled, of choice (if multiple).

<Into the Fray>.Effect:
When combat starts, determine which side is your Allied Side and which is the Enemy Side of the battlefield. Each side has a direction (Allied Direction and Enemy Direction).
If you end your turn more to the Allied Direction than you started, you gain 4 Shielding until the start of your next turn.
If you end your turn more to the Enemy Direction than you started, your first attack next turn deals 1d6 extra Damage.

<Glory Run>.Effect:
When combat starts, a Glory Point appears behind the furthermost Enemy from you that you can see.
If you touch the Glory Point, heal for 20% of your total Health and all Enemies you can see must become Dazed.
The Glory Point then disappears.
<Glory Run>.Notes: The Glory Point is not a physical thing. It's merely a concept (a point).

<Ruining Throw>.Effect:
Throw a weapon at a target and attack it (without Throwing penalties and ignoring Cover).
Before applying the Damage, the attack destroys all Shielding and Defense on the target and removes all buffs on it.
The target can't trigger "on roll", can't gain Shielding and can't benefit from Buffs until they spend an Action to recover.
<Ruining Throw>.Upgrade: Epic Monsters gain ther Defense back when they spend the Action to recover.
<Ruining Throw>.Notes:
Your weapon lands at the nearest space to the target (and you should probably pick it up with a Half-Action).
"On roll" refers to effects like "if it rolls 10 on a d10, the attack deals 1d10 extra Damage".
Buffs are all effects that improve the target; even passive effects like auras or passive stats from abilities are negated.
You don't need Training in Throwning and this attack counts as a regular melee attack.

<Personal Squire>.Effect:
You recruit a squire - a trusted NPC who gains combat powers. However, the capabilities of your squire are random: roll 1d6 to determine the type of your squire, based on the Squires category at Pets and Animals (1. Bold, 2. Sneaky, 3. Clever, 4. Wise). The Race is determined by the QM or by circumstance.
On its turn, it can do one Pet Attack, cast one Ability it has, or do the equivalent of a Half-Action (e.g. Dash, Push, etc).
You can recruit one squire per Adventure, but only one can follow you in your adventures at a time.
At the start of every Adventure (and when you get this Talent), you must spend 1 Mana and train your Squire to permanently increase its Health by 2 or gain one Ability from any other Squire type.
<Personal Squire>.Upgrade: If your squire drops to 0 Health, it becomes Fallen, like a player. It has no Health Regen, but at any point outside of combat, you (the pet owner) can spend 30 minutes to tend to your squire's wounds and heal it back to full Health.
<Personal Squire>.Notes: Your squire is not a Player Character by any means and does not behave like one (it can't use Weapons, Armor, Feats, Abilities, etc like a Player Character can). It is limited to what its stat block and Abilities say it can do. You can, however, give it orders, customize its looks (hair style, clothes, etc) and it will obey your commands within reason. You are the leader it looks up to. Lead proudly and fairly!

<Attack Command>.Effect:
An ally immediately makes an Act that takes 1 Action (can spend Mana, Cooldowns, etc on it, as if it were on its turn).
You can use this at any point, before or after someone does an Act.
^You^ roll all the dice for this Act.

<MIGHT OVER MAAAGIC!!!>.Effect:
Choose ^TWO^ Basic Abilities from the Elemental, Nature or Eldritch Schools that cost 1 Mana.
You can use each of those Abilities once per Adventure (without spending Mana).
See the Level 5 Talent _Might Over Magic_.

<Perfect Strike>.Effect:
Your next weapon attack this turn deals +300% Damage. If it kills the target, overkill Damage is dealt to all enemies within 3 meters of the main target.
Also, passively, you gain +2 Dexterity and you are immune to monster _weapon effects_ (e.g. critical strikes).

<Master Tactician>.Effect:
Gain +4 Max Health and +1 Damage on all attacks for every 3 sessions the Campaign has progressed.
From now on, at the end of every session, gain +4 Max Health and +1 Damage on all attacks.
Also, passively, gain +2 Intelligence and you know the Abilities and strategies of all enemies you encounter.

<Greatwielder>.Effect:
You can wield 2-Handed weapons, one in each hand.
Attacks like this take only a Half-Action and count as 1-Handed weapon attacks but deal -2 Damage.
While dual wielding 2-Handed weapons, if any Ability tells you to perform an attack with a 2-Handed and the ability costs 1 Action, it costs only Half-Action.
Also, passively, gain +1 Might and +1 Dexterity.
<Greatwielder>.Notes: If you already have a Technique Feat, you can remove it to refund the cost.

~Onslaught~.Effect: Whenever ^YOU^ kill a Worthy Enemy, heal for 1d6 Health. In addition, if an Enemy has 25% or less Health, you know exactly how much Health it has (ask the QM).

~Reckless Charge~.Effect:
Freely dash exactly 2 meters towards a Worthy Enemy, landing on the closest space. It becomes Rooted.
~Your next weapon attack deals 2d6 extra Damage to the target and half of that to yourself.~
You can only use this once on every Worthy Enemy.

<Heartbeat Trance>.Effect:
Take 1d6 Damage.
Then, until the ^end^ of your next turn, you take 50% less Damage (including from your own Abilities).
When Heartbeat Trance ends, heal for 1d6.

<Rage Trance>.Effect:
Take 1d6 Damage.
Until the ^end^ of your next turn, all your attacks deal +1d4 Damage and Onslaught healing is increased by 100%.
When Rage Trance ends, heal for 1d6.

<Battle Trance>.Effect:
Take 1d6 Damage.
Until the ^end^ of your next turn, you are immune to all Crowd Control, you have +1 range on all attacks, +2 Movement, can Break your Movement.
When Battle Trance ends, heal for 2d6.

<Death Mark>.Effect:
Mark a Unit you can see for death.
Whenever YOU deal Damage to it until your next turn, remember the Damage done.
At the start of your next turn, the mark bursts and the Unit takes 50% of the Damage it has taken in this time period.

<Glory Run>.Effect:
When combat starts, a Glory Point appears behind the furthermost Enemy from you that you can see.
If you touch the Glory Point, heal for 20% of your total Health and all Enemies you can see must become Dazed.
The Glory Point then disappears.
<Glory Run>.Notes: The Glory Point is not a physical thing. It's merely a concept (a point).

<Undying Rage>.Effect: Taking Damage that would kill you puts you in a state of primal rage, and leaves you at 1 Health instead, then you can't take damage until the start of your next turn. At the start of your next turn, heal for 2d6.

<Victory Strike>.Effect:
Attack a Unit for 2d10 Damage of your weapon's type.
Whenever ^YOU^ kill a Worthy Enemy (with anything), reset the Cooldown of this Ability.

<Frenzy>.Effect:
If you start your turn with 25 or less Health, you have +1 Movement Speed and can Break your Movement.
if you start with 15 or less Health, you also have an extra Half-Action.

<Hurl Over>.Effect:
Grab another non-Epic Unit and throw them up to 10 meters away.
Upon landing, all other Units within 3 meters of the landing place take 3d8 Pulse Damage.
If it was an Enemy, the Thrown Unit takes 50% of the Damage.

<Bloodbath>.Effect: You heal for all Damage done by Advanced Flank on Worthy Enemies.

<Flesh of Iron>.Effect:
You Heal for all Damage you would deal to yourself instead of taking it. Pierce, Slash and Smash attacks can't Damage you below 1 Health (they leave you to 1 Health).
Also, passively, you gain +2 Might.

<Ferocity Unleashed>.Effect:
If you start your turn with 50% or less Health, you have an extra 1 Action on your turn.
Also, passively, gain +1 Might, Dexterity and Sense, you are immune to exhaustion in Worthy Combat and you can survive without sleep for 7 days.
<Ferocity Unleashed>.Notes: This stacks with the Frenzy Talent.

<MIGHT BRAWN MUSCLE>.Effect: GAIN +10 MIGHT AND THE RESULTS OF ALL YOUR MIGHT CHECKS ARE DOUBLED.

~Uncharge~.Effect:
Freely dash 2 meters ~away from~ a Worthy Enemy. ~Its first attack on its next Turn deals -2 Damage.
You can only use this once on every Worthy Enemy.

~Marksmanship~.Effect: YOU can Flank a Unit from any range (if you, the target, and the ally, wall or obstacle are on the same line).
~Marksmanship~.Notes: As usual, that ally, wall or obstacle helping with your Flank must be right behind the target (meaning allies can't Flank an enemy with you being far away).

~Load Up~.Effect:
You _load up_ your weapons. After you _load up_, your Advanced Flank die becomes 1d12 instead of 1d6, but every time you use it, the Advanced Flank die becomes ^Downgraded^ (down to 1d4).
If the attack kills the target, don't Downgrade.

<Recoiling Uncharge>.Effect:
Freely dash up to 2 meters away from a Worthy Enemy. Its first attack on its next Turn deals -2 Damage.
~If it's non-Epic, push it 2 meters away from you. If it collides with something, deal Damage with your current Advanced Flank (load up) die.~
You can only use this once on every Worthy Enemy.
<Recoiling Uncharge>.Notes: Dealing Damage with this ^Downgrades^ the Advanced Flank die.

<Harpoon Load Up>.Effect:
You _load up_ your weapons. After you _load up_, your Advanced Flank die becomes 1d12 instead of 1d6, but every time you use it, the Advanced Flank die becomes ^Downgraded^ (down to 1d4).
~If you roll maximum on the Advanced Flank die, deal an extra 1d6 Damage and either pull yourself to the target, or pull the target to you (your choice).~
If the attack kills the target, don't Downgrade.
<Harpoon Load Up>.Notes: {DiceDowngrade}. Requires a Harpoon, which can be bought for 50 Gold.

<Precise Rune>.Effect:
Craft a Precise Rune.
Inscribe on a weapon to permanently replace one Stat in its text (e.g. Might) with number 4.
The wielder of the weapon is also immune to being Crippled and has +1 Movement Speed.
<Precise Rune>.Notes: You can only have one weapon with the Precise Rune at a time. When you apply a Precise Rune to a different, the other one loses its Precise Rune.

<Ground Aim Lock>.Effect:
On your turn, you can freely lower yourself on the ground without penalties.
Your first attack every turn while on the ground like this deals +1d6 Damage.
<Ground Aim Lock>.Notes: To get up, you must use all a Half-Action.

<Scatterblast>.Effect:
Make an attack on a target for 3d8 + 2 Smash Damage.
The impact is so powerful that all Units within 3 meters of the target take the final Damage taken by the target.
This attack is affected by your Reload state.

<Crosshair Shot>.Effect:
Make an attack on a target.
For each meter to the target, the attack deals 1d6 Pierce Damage, up to 7 meters.
For each meter to the target over 7 meters, deal one less d6.
<Crosshair Shot>.Notes: At exactly 7 meters range, the attack deals 7d6 Damage. At 6 and 8 meters, it deals 6d6. At 5 and 9 meters, 5d6. And so on.

<Surprise Shot>.Effect: Your first weapon attack every combat instantly Stuns the target.

<Offense Is Defense>.Effect: Whenever you roll maximum on the Advanced Flank die, gain Shielding equal to the roll.

<Crescendo Technique>.Effect:
When NOT flanking a Unit, whenever you make a weapon attack, make another identical attack on the same target for free that does the same Damage (but does not apply effects like Smite and weapon effects).
When you flank a Unit, it becomes Feared.
Also, passively, gain +2 Dexterity and you automatically pass Very Hard Dexterity Checks (requiring at least 20).

<Precision Perfection>.Effect: Use after rolling Damage for an attack. You can ignore all the dice rolled and just take maximum Damage for all of them.
<Precision Perfection>.Notes: Weapon effects might not trigger, since the roll was ignored.

<Make Every Shot Count>.Effect: Every time you make a weapon attack, roll 1d4 to determine an additional effect for it.

Values: Reset your Load Up to d12
Damages all Units in a 5-meter line behind the target for 100% of the Damage
Stun the target and push it 6 meters away from you

<Make Every Shot Count>.Notes: The Load Up die resets before applying it if it was applied.
